newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Filipinas protest over exploitation.
newsitem.headline: HK Filipinas protest over exploitation.

text.p: Visiting Philippines President Fidel Ramos saw a modest show of "maid power" in Hong Kong on Thursday when activists from the territory's 140,000-strong Filipina maid community staged a protest over exploitation.
"Stop exploitation, oppression and suppression of Filipino migrant workers," the maids shouted outside Hong Kong's Grand Hyatt Hotel, where Ramos was attending an investment conference.
Some 20 Filipina maids brandished banners and accused Ramos of allowing the Philippine government and job agencies to exploit them.

Hong Kong's Filipina maids are protected by a minimum wage rule set by the Hong Kong government at about HK$4,000 (US$516), but many complain they are forced to pay high fees by job agents who help them get to the territory.
